Questionnaire name: Introduction to Programming Languages - Advanced Quiz

Questions.Question: What is the main reason ALGOL 60, despite being superior to FORTRAN in structure, did not become more popular?

Answers.a: It was too costly to implement.
Answers.c: It was not widely promoted or adopted.

Questions.Question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the Language Evaluation Criteria?
How does too much orthogonality in a language negatively impact it?

Answers.a: It increases the learning curve drastically.
Answers.b: It introduces a lot of syntactic sugar.
Answers.c: It leads to complex and unreadable code constructs.
Answers.d: It forces all variables to be strongly typed.

Questions.Question: Why is abstraction considered critical for writability?

Answers.a: It enforces strict typing across all constructs.
Answers.b: It limits the use of complex operators.
Answers.c: It allows ignoring implementation details when using structures or operations.
Answers.d: It forces a language to follow a rigid structure.

Questions.Question: Which language category is primarily rule-based with no specific execution order?
Which language was highlighted for being most orthogonal?
Which of the following contributes LEAST to the readability of a language?
Which of the following best describes aliasing in the context of programming languages?

Answers.a: A method of hiding implementation details.
Answers.b: Using symbols to create readable code.
Answers.c: Two or more ways of referencing the same memory location.

Questions.Question: Which language was developed primarily for text processing tasks?
Why is run-time type checking generally less desirable than compile-time checking?

Answers.a: It makes the code more readable.
Answers.c: It is more expensive in terms of execution time.
Answers.d: It restricts the use of dynamic typing.

Questions.Question: Which language design principle emphasizes a small number of rules and primitives?
What is the costliest phase in terms of maintenance according to the lecture?
Which category of programming languages includes C and Java?
Which of the following is an example of process abstraction?
What is a key reason for learning multiple programming languages?

Answers.a: It is a job requirement for all companies.
Answers.c: It increases ability to express ideas and design better software.
Answers.d: It is mandatory in most programming courses.

Questions.Question: Which language design aspect is directly influenced by word concatenation characters?
What is an example of operator overloading that is generally considered acceptable?

Answers.b: Using + for string concatenation and numeric addition

Questions.Question: Which language is best suited for matrix processing tasks according to the lesson?
What is the main goal of studying programming language concepts?

Answers.c: To choose, understand, and design better languages

Questions.Question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a special-purpose language?
Which language is often used in Artificial Intelligence due to its symbolic programming?
Which of the following is a cost factor that results from inefficient run-time type checking?
What does the term 'expressivity' in a language relate to?

Answers.a: The ability to support logical reasoning
Answers.b: The number of keywords in a language
Answers.c: The ease of specifying operations in code
Answers.d: The ability to abstract away hardware details

Questions.Question: Why is compile-time error detection preferred over run-time detection?

Answers.c: It identifies errors earlier, saving time and cost.

Questions.Question: Which feature is critical for the portability of programming languages?
